definition: private room (in a restaurant, bath house, etc)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: Would you prefer a table in a private room or in the main dining hall?
sentences.chinese: 你們要一個雅間還是在大廳就座？

sentences.english: One of the larger rooms even houses a piano.
sentences.chinese: 在一個大一些的雅間內甚至還放着一部鋼琴。

sentences.english: Private rooms are available.Do you want one?
sentences.chinese: 雅間可以的，您要一間嗎？

sentences.english: Seven thirty. Would you please set us in a private room?
sentences.chinese: 七點半。能給我們安排雅間嗎？

sentences.english: I am very sorry. There is only one table for four left in the hall. Is a private room all right?
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，大廳裏只有四人座的桌子了，雅間可以嗎？
